intro: Bourreria teitensis, commonly known as the Taiti burrbean, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that contains several seeds. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to coastal environments.
